trans-unit.source: Voxel Cone Tracing Global Illumination
trans-unit.target: Voxel Cone Tracing Global Illumination

trans-unit.source: Howto: setup existing project with Voxel Cone Tracing GI
trans-unit.target: Howto: setup existing project with Voxel Cone Tracing GI

trans-unit.source: Reference Stride.Voxels
trans-unit.target: Reference Stride.Voxels

trans-unit.source: Since Stride is modular based, we need to add a reference to Stride.Voxels plugin:
trans-unit.target: Since Stride is modular based, we need to add a reference to Stride.Voxels plugin:

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the user project
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer, right-click on the user project

trans-unit.source: Select Add Dependency
trans-unit.target: Select Add Dependency

trans-unit.source: Add dependency
trans-unit.target: Add dependency

trans-unit.source: Select Stride.Voxels in the list and press OK
trans-unit.target: Select Stride.Voxels in the list and press OK

trans-unit.source: You might be asked if you want to reload project, choose whichever option, both are OK.
trans-unit.target: You might be asked if you want to reload project, choose whichever option, both are OK.

trans-unit.source: Graphics Compositor
trans-unit.target: Graphics Compositor

trans-unit.source: Voxel Cone Tracing requires several changes to the graphics compositor.
trans-unit.target: Voxel Cone Tracing requires several changes to the graphics compositor.

trans-unit.source: To make this easier, we prepared a graphics compositor ready to use with Voxel GI in the asset templates:
trans-unit.target: To make this easier, we prepared a graphics compositor ready to use with Voxel GI in the asset templates:

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click

trans-unit.source: Start to type Voxel in the search bar
trans-unit.target: Start to type Voxel in the search bar

trans-unit.source: Select Graphics Compositor (Voxel Cone Tracing)
trans-unit.target: Select Graphics Compositor (Voxel Cone Tracing)

trans-unit.source: Create Graphics Compositor
trans-unit.target: Create Graphics Compositor

trans-unit.source: In your Game Settings asset, change the graphics compositor to the newly created one:
trans-unit.target: In your Game Settings asset, change the graphics compositor to the newly created one:

trans-unit.source: Set Graphics Compositor
trans-unit.target: Set Graphics Compositor

trans-unit.source: Setup scene: Volume and Light
trans-unit.target: Setup scene: Volume and Light

trans-unit.source: In the scene explorer, above the Entity Tree, click the Plus icon and select Lights then Voxel volume
trans-unit.target: In the scene explorer, above the Entity Tree, click the Plus icon and select Lights then Voxel volume

trans-unit.source: Click the Plus icon again and select Lights then Voxel light
trans-unit.target: Click the Plus icon again and select Lights then Voxel light

trans-unit.source: At that point, the scene rendering will likely crash due to the light not being setup correctly (with error No Voxel Volume Component selected for voxel light.), but that's expected.
trans-unit.target: At that point, the scene rendering will likely crash due to the light not being setup correctly (with error No Voxel Volume Component selected for voxel light.), but that's expected.

trans-unit.source: In the property grid, change the Light Volume to the previously created entity:
trans-unit.target: In the property grid, change the Light Volume to the previously created entity:

trans-unit.source: Setup light volume
trans-unit.target: Setup light volume

trans-unit.source: At that point, you can click the Resume button in scene renderer, and everything should be setup!
trans-unit.target: At that point, you can click the Resume button in scene renderer, and everything should be setup!

trans-unit.source: Play with it
trans-unit.target: Play with it

trans-unit.source: To do a quick test, you can disable Skybox light (keep only directional light), go in shadow area and see if some ambient light spread there. You can also play with emissive materials.
trans-unit.target: To do a quick test, you can disable Skybox light (keep only directional light), go in shadow area and see if some ambient light spread there. You can also play with emissive materials.

trans-unit.target: Video tutorial

trans-unit.target: Here's a youtube alternative tutorial made by David Jeske on how to set it up:
